intro: Eurybia compacta, commonly known as dwarf sunflower, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust growth habit. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet, with gray-green foliage and showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil, making it a versatile choice for gardens. Eurybia compacta is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
